item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。特朗普谈税收、关税和鲍威尔。华尔街交易员纷纷涌向风险资产。美国大型银行的股票交易逊于预期。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Trump talks taxes, tariffs and Powell. Wall Street traders rushed to riskier assets. Equity trading crushed estimates at big US banks. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中国不锈钢大亨努力避免第二次倒闭
item.description: 中国金属大亨戴国芳的第一个钢铁帝国因政府遏制市场繁荣的运动、逃税指控和身陷囹圄而垮台。二十年后，他再次为生存而战。【原文：Chinese metal tycoon Dai Guofang’s first steel empire was brought down by a government campaign to rein in market exuberance, tax evasion accusations and a spell behind bars. Two decades on, he’s once again fighting for survival.】

item.title: 股价回升后，国民银行将为 CWB 交易筹集更多资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，加拿大国民银行正在为其收购加拿大西部银行的计划额外筹资 2000 万加元（1500 万美元）。【原文：National Bank of Canada is raising an additional C$20 million ($15 million) in connection with its planned acquisition of Canadian Western Bank, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 必和必拓铁矿石发货量符合生产指导目标
item.description: 在截至 6 月底的三个月里，全球最大的矿商必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd. ）共装运了 6921 万吨铁矿石。【原文：The world’s largest miner BHP Group Ltd. shipped 69.21 million tons of iron ore over the three months to the end of June.】

item.title: 市场综述：亚洲股市加入全球涨势，国债上涨
item.description: 亚洲股市将加入全球股市反弹的行列，因为对美联储将很快开始降息的押注助长了市场中风险较高的股票的抢购热潮。【原文：Asian equities were set to join a global stock rally as bets the Federal Reserve will soon start cutting rates fueled a rush into riskier corners of the market.】

item.title: 中国央行利用对冲基金策略驯服债券牛市
item.description: 中国央行正准备在全球货币政策领域进行一次大胆的新实验；借鉴对冲基金的做法，安排卖空债券。【原文：China’s central bank is readying a bold new experiment in global monetary policy — taking a leaf out of the hedge fund playbook and arranging to short sell bonds.】

item.title: 就美国经济计划采访特朗普
item.description:
商界领袖们并不喜欢特朗普的所有政策，但在总统竞选几经波折之后，他在一些出人意料的地方赢得了声援。【原文：

Business leaders don’t love all of Trump’s policies, but after several twists in the presidential campaign, he’s earning vocal support in some surprising quarters.

】

item.title: BuzzFeed 在普尔特收购激进派股份并支持拉马斯瓦米后上涨
item.description: 在美国住宅建筑商普尔特集团（PulteGroup Inc.【原文：Shares of BuzzFeed Inc. closed higher on Tuesday after the founding family of US homebuilder PulteGroup Inc. disclosed an activist stake in the struggling media company.】

item.title: 债券交易员看淡特朗普交易，大举押注美联储降息
item.description: 在国债期货和期权市场上，交易商们正大举押注美联储更早、更大幅度的降息。【原文：It’s game on in the Treasuries futures and options markets where traders are piling into bets for earlier, deeper interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚石油公司指责银行和公用事业公司阻碍改革
item.description: 古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）总统在本周二签署其加强国家对哥伦比亚养老金控制的旗舰计划时，指责国家银行业和能源部门试图阻挠他的社会改革。【原文：President Gustavo Petro accused the nation’s banking and energy sectors of trying to block his social reforms during the signing of his flagship plan to boost state control over Colombian pensions on Tuesday.】

item.title: 摩根大通高管离职，加入财富科技平台担任首席信息官
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Ankit Misra is leaving the firm to join wealth tech platform Collective Liquidity as its chief investment officer.】

item.title: 华尔街经济学家认为美联储现在就减息有说服力
item.description: 越来越多的华尔街经济学家警告说，美联储在将利率提高到二十年来的最高点后，等待扭转方向的时间太长了。【原文：A growing number of Wall Street economists are cautioning the Federal Reserve is waiting too long to reverse course after raising interest rates to a two-decade high.】

item.title: 泰森-海尔在阿肯色州醉驾被捕后认罪
item.description: 约翰-泰森（John R. Tyson）是泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods Inc.【原文：John R. Tyson, the suspended chief financial officer of Tyson Foods Inc., pleaded not guilty to charges of driving while intoxicated.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉在选举消费狂潮中增加美元供应
item.description: 委内瑞拉政府正在加大美元销售力度，以遏制尼古拉斯-马杜罗的总统竞选开支所带来的通货膨胀效应。【原文：Venezuela’s government is ramping up dollar sales to contain inflationary effects resulting from Nicolás Maduro’s presidential campaign spending.】

item.title: 债券销售激增，投资者需求旺盛
item.description: 由于越来越多的人预期美联储最快将于 9 月份开始降息，发行商们将目光投向了借贷成本降低的前景，市政债券的销售量正以几周来最快的速度激增。【原文：Municipal bond sales are surging at the fastest clip in weeks as issuers focus on the prospect of lower borrowing costs amid growing expectations that the Federal Reserve will start cutting interest rates as soon as September.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体向不知名的、对 SPAC 友好的新泽西基金筹集资金
item.description: 新泽西州一家鲜为人知的专注于为微型和小型公司提供融资的投资管理公司找到了最引人注目的交易：唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体创业公司。【原文：A little-known New Jersey investment manager that focuses on financing micro-cap and small-cap companies has found its most high-profile deal: Donald Trump’s media startup.】

item.title: 希腊将对发电商征收一次性税款以补贴电费
item.description: 在近期电力批发价格上涨之后，希腊计划在 8 月份采取措施降低电费。【原文：Greece plans to take steps to ease electricity bills in August after a recent rise in wholesale power prices.】

item.title: 美国银行强调美联储降息前景暗淡
item.description: 华尔街对美联储今年降息幅度的担忧在美国银行（Bank of America Corp.【原文：The angst on Wall Street over how much the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this year was laid bare in Bank of America Corp.’s latest results.】

item.title: 杰富瑞从巴克莱聘请艾布拉姆森负责化工交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，杰富瑞金融集团公司（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Jefferies Financial Group Inc. has hired Adam Abramson from Barclays Plc as global head of chemicals investment banking, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 加密货币期权交易商即将可以美国总统选举结果为目标下注
item.description: 加密货币衍生品交易所 Deribit 正在提供比特币和以太币期权，使投资者能够在即将到来的美国总统大选结束后立即定制赌注。【原文：Crypto derivatives exchange Deribit is providing Bitcoin and Ether options that enable investors to customize bets for right after the conclusion of the upcoming US presidential election.】

item.title: 部长称南非旅游业增长强劲
item.description: 南非旅游部长帕特里夏-德-里尔（Patricia de Lille）表示，1 月至 5 月间，南非旅游人数同比增长 9.7%，达到约 380 万人次。【原文：South African tourism grew by 9.7% to about 3.8 million arrivals between January and May, compared with a year ago, Tourism Minister Patricia de Lille said.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉政府镇压行动在 7 月 28 日投票前激增
item.description: 据总部设在加拉加斯的一个人权组织周二报告，自委内瑞拉总统竞选活动于 7 月 4 日开始以来，已有约 77 名反对派支持者和助手被捕。【原文：About 77 opposition supporters and aides have been arrested since Venezuela’s presidential campaign began on July 4, a Caracas-based human rights organization reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 前保守党议员成立投资银行，帮助新市场 "改变世界
item.description: 一位前保守党大臣正在建立一家私人投资银行，以支持专注于影响力、未来技术和零净排放的扩大规模企业。【原文：An ex-Tory minister is setting up a private investment bank to support scale-up firms focused on impact, future technologies and net zero.】

item.title: 以太币 ETF 现货最早将于下周开始交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，美国证券交易委员会已向至少四家以太币现货交易基金发行商发出了提交文件申请批准的指示。其中三家发行商表示，该机构已发出信号，表示可能会在 7 月 23 日开始交易。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission has given indications to at least four issuers of spot-Ether exchange-traded funds to file paperwork for potential approval, according to people familiar with the matter. Three of the issuers said the agency signaled trading may begin on July 23.】

item.title: 加纳启动 5.32 亿美元危机后扶持企业计划
item.description: 在债务重组拖累企业增长之后，加纳启动了一项扶持中小企业的计划。【原文：Ghana has kicked off an initiative to bolster its small and medium-sized enterprises after a debt restructuring weighed on business growth.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）发出警告：莫桑比克将裁减 5000 名幽灵工人
item.description: 据国际货币基金组织称，莫桑比克将在本月底之前从工资单上清除至少 5000 名所谓的 "幽灵工人"。【原文：Mozambique will by the end of the month remove at least 5,000 so-called ghost workers from its payroll, according to the International Monetary Fund, which had warned the southeast African nation over its ballooning public wage bill.】

item.title: 惠誉评级提升后，达美航空重返投资级地位
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将达美航空（Delta Air Lines Inc.【原文：Fitch Ratings raised Delta Air Lines Inc. out of junk territory, making the carrier a so-called rising star with a second investment-grade rating.】

item.title: 欧盟国家表示支持对中国电动汽车征收临时关税
item.description: 欧盟成员国在本周举行的一次不具约束力的秘密投票中表示，支持对从中国运来的电动汽车征收临时关税，这表明欧盟希望就贸易问题向世界第二大经济体发起挑战。【原文：European Union member states signaled support for provisional tariffs on electric vehicles shipped from China in a secret non-binding vote this week that showed the bloc’s appetite for taking on the world’s second-biggest economy over trade concerns.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司初级债券下挫，严重减值风险增加
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）的债券跌至极度不良水平，原因是投资者对债务重组过程中大幅减持的风险进行了定价。【原文：A Thames Water bond has dropped to deeply distressed levels as investors price in the risk of a significant haircut during a debt restructuring process.】

item.title: 欧盟对中国电动汽车进口征收关税后，英国考虑采取应对措施
item.description: 在欧盟对从中国进口的电动汽车征收临时关税后，英国政府表示 "关注 "电动汽车进口的影响，并考虑可能采取的行动。【原文：The UK government said it’s “concerned” about the impact of electric vehicle imports and considering potential action, after the European Union moved to impose provisional tariffs on EVs imported from China.】
